  • Introducing the ENIGMA TOOLBOX üß∞
  • View page source

Welcome to the ENIGMA TOOLBOX üëãüèº¬∂


Data sharing üíå¬∂

As part of the ENIGMA TOOLBOX, we are making several data matrices openly available! As of now, these include functional and structural connectivity data as well as transcriptomic data.


Harmonization of analytical methods üëØ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è¬∂

One key goal of the ENIGMA TOOLBOX is to harmonize analytical methods both within and across ENIGMA Working Groups, ultimately facilitating comparisons of imaging and genetic findings across diseases.


Visualization tools üé®¬∂

Tired of displaying your surface findings in tables? Look no further! The ENIGMA TOOLBOX has got you covered! Check out our visualization tools and project your cortical and subcortical data to the surface!


Step-by-step tutorials üë£¬∂

The ENIGMA TOOLBOX has a No data, No problem policy! To make things easier, we provide example data that have been processed according to ENIGMA protocols. Using these example data, you can complete all of the tutorials. Alternatively, easily replace our example data with other ENIGMA-derived datasets!


Development and getting involved ‚öôÔ∏è¬∂

Should you have any problems, questions, or suggestions about the ENIGMA TOOLBOX, please do not hesitate to post them to our Github issues! Or are you interested in collaborating or sharing your ENIGMA-related codes/tools? Noice! Make sure you familiarize yourself with our contributing guidelines first and then discuss your ideas on our Github issues and pull request.
